reference.shortdesc: The screen element contains a textual representation of a terminal console or other text-based computer interface.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Processors SHOULD preserve the line breaks and spaces that are present in the content of a screen element.
The contents of the screen element is typically enclosed within a box to suggest a computer display screen. It also is typically rendered in a monospaced font.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The screen element is specialized from pre. It is defined in the user-interface domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the screen element is used to illustrate the steps needed to clone a git repository and check status:
example.codeblock:
<screen> workspace $ git clone git@example.com:oasis-tcs/dita-techcomm.git Cloning into 'dita-techcomm'... remote: Enumerating objects: 1023, done. remote: Counting objects: 100% (31/31), done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (23/23), done. remote: Total 1023 (delta 6), reused 21 (delta 4), pack-reused 992 Receiving objects: 100% (1023/1023), 9.87 MiB | 729.00 KiB/s, done. Resolving deltas: 100% (367/367), done. workspace $ cd dita-techcomm dita-techcomm $ git status On branch main Your branch is up to date with 'origin/main'.
nothing to commit, working tree clean dita-techcomm $ </screen>
